details:
Several vulnerabilities have been fixed in the libstb library.


* [CVE-2018-16981](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-16981)
Heap-based buffer overflow in stbi\_\_out\_gif\_code().
* [CVE-2019-13217](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-13217)
Heap buffer overflow in the Vorbis start\_decoder().
* [CVE-2019-13218](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-13218)
Division by zero in the Vorbis predict\_point().
* [CVE-2019-13219](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-13219)
NULL pointer dereference in the Vorbis get\_window().
* [CVE-2019-13220](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-13220)
Uninitialized stack variables in the Vorbis start\_decoder().
* [CVE-2019-13221](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-13221)
Buffer overflow in the Vorbis compute\_codewords().
* [CVE-2019-13222](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-13222)
Out-of-bounds read of a global buffer in the Vorbis draw\_line().
* [CVE-2019-13223](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-13223)
Reachable assertion in the Vorbis lookup1\_values().
* [CVE-2021-28021](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-28021)
Buffer overflow in stbi\_\_extend\_receive().
* [CVE-2021-37789](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-37789)
Heap-based buffer overflow in stbi\_\_jpeg\_load().
* [CVE-2021-42715](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-42715)
The HDR loader parsed truncated end-of-file RLE scanlines as an
 infinite sequence of zero-length runs.
* [CVE-2022-28041](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2022-28041)
Integer overflow in stbi\_\_jpeg\_decode\_block\_prog\_dc().
* [CVE-2022-28042](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2022-28042)
Heap-based use-after-free in stbi\_\_jpeg\_huff\_decode().


For Debian 10 buster, these problems have been fixed in version
0.0~git20180212.15.e6afb9c-1+deb10u1.


We recommend that you upgrade your libstb packages.


For the detailed security status of libstb please refer to
its security tracker page at:
<https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/libstb>


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
